intro: Serjania subdentata f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf serjania, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking yellow and orange flowers arranged in panicle inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation.
